column4: Help  NX will not let me click the "unlock" button  on network settings, or users and groups or any management functions.
do you have permission to administer the system>
yes
at least I think I do :) lol
can you run commands with sudo?
yes
try opening a terminal and typeing: sudo network-manager
command not found
try: sudo network-admin
that opend it, but still no go
is it unlocked? Can't click unlock still?
correct, can not unlock, and can not change any settings
I would try one of two things: reboot into recovery (single user mode) set your wireless settings there, or post to the forums.
Thank you, I have been following some forum posts, I think someone tried something with policy kit.  Ill look some more, but thanks for taking the time.
I wish I knew what to do, but unfortuneatly you get higher visiability in the forums,
something about NX and remote connections is wonky.
have you thought about a clean re-install?
No, others with clean install have same problem.
did you file  a bug report with launchpad?
Um, no, still kind of new,  box is mostly file server and only messed with it enough to break it :) still learning but its fun.
I would consider doing a clean install see what happens.  Do you have a /home partition/
I think so, but I am going to wait for a bit and keep trolling the forum... not quite ready to reinstall.
I would recommened backing up the /home partition and then reformatting it incase the problem is on your home partition
